docs.snippet: No longer will New England have a Republican in the House of Representatives.     Christopher Shays of Connecticut, the lone conservative in a region long dyed blue, suffered a startling defeat to a Democratic businessman from Greenwich, Jim Himes...
docs.lead_paragraph: No longer will New England have a Republican in the House of Representatives. Christopher Shays of Connecticut, the lone conservative in a region long dyed blue, suffered a startling defeat to a Democratic businessman from Greenwich, Jim Himes.
docs.abstract: Democrat Jim Hines defeats incumbent Republican Rep Christopher Shays in Connecticut House race; Democratic incumbents John B Larson, Joe Courtney, Rosa DeLauro and Christopher S Murphy win re-election; Barack Obama wins state, 60-39 percent (M)

docs.snippet: Senator Barack Obama easily carried Iowa, the state where his presidential ambitions took flight with his success in the Democratic caucuses in January. He received more votes on Tuesday than any presidential candidate in the state's history.     ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Barack Obama easily carried Iowa, the state where his presidential ambitions took flight with his success in the Democratic caucuses in January. He received more votes on Tuesday than any presidential candidate in the state's history. Senator John McCain had alienated some voters with his outspoken criticism of agricultural subsidies, especially those for ethanol.
docs.abstract: Iowa Sen Tom Harkin retains his seat, defeating challenge by Republican Christopher Reed; in Congressional election, incumbent Democrats Dave Loebsack, Bruce Braley and Leonard L Boswell and Republicans Steve King and Tom Latham retain their seats; Barack Obama wins state, 54-45 percent; tallies (S)

docs.snippet: In just a generation, Maryland has turned from a longtime swing state -- George Bush won there in 1988 -- to a solid blue swatch on the national map, and it is more Democratic than ever this year.     Democrats appear to have taken a Republican-he...
docs.lead_paragraph: In just a generation, Maryland has turned from a longtime swing state -- George Bush won there in 1988 -- to a solid blue swatch on the national map, and it is more Democratic than ever this year. Democrats appear to have taken a Republican-held House seat, giving them seven of Maryland's eight districts.
docs.abstract: Democrat Frank M Kratovil Jr leads Republican Andy Harris in tight race for Maryland Congressional seat; Barack Obama wins state, 61-38 percent; tally (S)

docs.snippet: Pennsylvania, long described as a swing state or a battleground state, helped Senator Barack Obama clinch his victory. Senator John McCain made an all-out push here, but Mr. Obama became the fifth Democrat in a row to carry the state in a presiden...
docs.lead_paragraph: Pennsylvania, long described as a swing state or a battleground state, helped Senator Barack Obama clinch his victory. Senator John McCain made an all-out push here, but Mr. Obama became the fifth Democrat in a row to carry the state in a presidential election. Mr. Obama received strong support in Philadelphia and ran well in parts of northeastern Pennsylvania that Mr. McCain had been counting on.
docs.abstract: Democrat Kathy Dahlkemper defeats incumbent Republican Rep Phil English in Pennsylvania Congressional election; incumbent Democratic Rep John Murtha defeats Republican William Russell; Democrat Paul E Kanjorski defeat Republican Lou Barletta; Democratic Rep Jason Altmire defeats Republican Melissa Hart; Barack Obama wins state, 55-44 percent (M)

docs.snippet: The actions constituted a broad effort to loosen rules enacted after the financial crisis that restrict the way Wall Street can operate....
docs.lead_paragraph: The actions constituted a broad effort to loosen rules enacted after the financial crisis that restrict the way Wall Street can operate.

docs.snippet: To be a presidential candidate is not unlike being the leader of an improvisational theater troupe. Each day is pregnant with bizarre possibility....
docs.lead_paragraph: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla. -- To be a presidential candidate is not unlike being the leader of an improvisational theater troupe. Each day is pregnant with bizarre possibility.
docs.abstract: To be a presidential candidate is not unlike being the leader of an improvisational theater troupe. Each day is pregnant with bizarre possibility.

docs.snippet: The state of the economy was a major concern with voters in Florida and that benefited Senator Barack Obama, who drew strong support from voters in Miami and Tampa, as well as from Latinos in a state where they have traditionally voted Republican....
docs.lead_paragraph: The state of the economy was a major concern with voters in Florida and that benefited Senator Barack Obama, who drew strong support from voters in Miami and Tampa, as well as from Latinos in a state where they have traditionally voted Republican. Several of the state's 25 seats in the House of Representatives switched hands. In the Eighth District, Alan Grayson, a Democratic challenger, beat the incumbent, Ric Keller, a four-term Republican congressman who won the district, in the center of the state, by seven percentage points in 2006.
docs.abstract: In Florida Congressional races, Democrat Alan Grayson beats incumbent Republican Ric Keller; Republican incumbent Tom Feeney loses to Democrat Suzanne Kosmas; Republican Tom Rooney defeats incumbent Democrat Tim Mahoney; Republican Bill Posey defeats Democrat Stephen Blythe; voters approve measure that defines marriage as union between man and woman; Barack Obama wins state, 51-48 percent; tally (S)

docs.snippet: Gov. Christine Gregoire, a Washington Democrat, was headed to a decisive victory in her closely fought bid for re-election against her Republican challenger, Dino Rossi. Her victory came four years after she survived her first matchup with Mr. Ros...
docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Christine Gregoire, a Washington Democrat, was headed to a decisive victory in her closely fought bid for re-election against her Republican challenger, Dino Rossi. Her victory came four years after she survived her first matchup with Mr. Rossi, a former state senator, by only 133 votes. With more than half of all ballots counted, Ms. Gregoire held a clear lead, about 54 percent to 46 percent. Many ballots in heavily Democratic areas, including King County, had yet to be counted.
docs.abstract: Democratic Gov Christine Gregoire holds lead in her bid for re-election over Republican challenger Dino Rossi; voters overwhelmingly approve ballot measure to legalize physician-assisted suicide; Congressional race between Rep Dave Reichert and his Democratic challenger Darcy Burner is too close to call; Barack Obama wins state, 57-41 percent; tallies (S)
